title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Medical Simulation Education Design

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary Medical Knowledge and Introductory Clinical Skills
context.additional_context: Online environment combining simulation practice and theoretical learning using personal devices, with continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners apply basic clinical protocols (patient assessment, diagnostic reasoning, treatment planning) with 80% accuracy in simulation environments
Learners systematically make decisions while reducing cognitive load by 20% in complex clinical scenarios
Learners maintain performance levels of 75 points or higher (out of 100) in three or more formative assessments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
